issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Load Balancer cannot be created after Auto Scaling Group

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

If an autoscaling group is created and associated to an ELB, the Load Balancer doesn't register the instances that are part of the autoscaling group.

{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	NginxScalingGroup	NginxLaunchConfig	UndergroundLuxury	NginxLoadBalancer	2	3	2	NewestInstance
INSTANCE	i-D49986FE	UndergroundLuxury	InService	Healthy	NginxLaunchConfig
INSTANCE	i-A400FC3B	UndergroundLuxury	InService	Healthy	NginxLaunchConfig
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# eulb-describe-instance-health NginxLoadBalancer
[root@odc-f-13 ~]#
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# eulb-describe-lbs NginxLoadBalancer
LOAD_BALANCER	NginxLoadBalancer	NginxLoadBalancer-708773612111.lb.localhost	2014-05-19T01:11:41.211Z
{code}

*Pertinent Data*

This keeps cloud users from [deploying load balanced, autoscaling groups - which can be done on AWS|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/DeveloperGuide/US_SetUpASLBApp.html].

*Steps*

* Set up Eucalyptus 3.4.2/4.0.0 Cloud, with the load balancing service enabled
* Bundle, upload and register an EMI
* Create an autoscaling group, associated to the name of the load balancer:
{code}
$ euscale-create-auto-scaling-group NginxScalingGroup --launch-configuration NginxLaunchConfig --load-balancers NginxLoadBalancer --availability-zones UndergroundLuxury --min-size 2 --max-size 3
$ euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	NginxScalingGroup	NginxLaunchConfig	UndergroundLuxury	NginxLoadBalancer	2	3	2	NewestInstance
INSTANCE	i-D49986FE	UndergroundLuxury	InService	Healthy	NginxLaunchConfig
INSTANCE	i-A400FC3B	UndergroundLuxury	InService	Healthy	NginxLaunchConfig
{code}
* Create the load balancer:
{code}
$ eulb-create-lb -z UndergroundLuxury -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80,instance-protocol=HTTP" NginxLoadBalancer
DNS_NAME	NginxLoadBalancer-708773612111.lb.localhost
{code}
* Check the health of the instances associated to the load balancer:
{code}
$ eulb-describe-instance-health NginxLoadBalancer
$
{code}

*Workaround*

Instances can be added to Load Balancer by using [eulb-register-instances-with-lb|https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.4/index.html#user-guide/elb_examples_basic_config.html].
fields.summary: Load Balancer Doesn't Register Instances from AutoScaling Group
fields.environment:
*non-HA, single cluster, Eucalyptus 4.0
** 1 x CLC
** 1 x UFS, Walrus
** 1 x CC/SC (Overlay)
** 1 x NC
* output of euca-describe-services
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-services
SERVICE	autoscaling       	Throwback 	Throwback.autoscaling	ENABLED 	26  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:autoscaling:Throwback.autoscaling/
SERVICE	cloudwatch        	Throwback 	Throwback.cloudwatch 	ENABLED 	26  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:cloudwatch:Throwback.cloudwatch/
SERVICE	compute           	Throwback 	Throwback.compute    	ENABLED 	26  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:compute:Throwback.compute/
SERVICE	euare             	Throwback 	Throwback.euare      	ENABLED 	26  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/Euare	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:euare:Throwback.euare/
SERVICE	loadbalancing     	Throwback 	Throwback.loadbalancing	ENABLED 	26  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:loadbalancing:Throwback.loadbalancing/
SERVICE	objectstorage     	Throwback 	Throwback.objectstorage	ENABLED 	26  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/objectstorage	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:objectstorage:Throwback.objectstorage/
SERVICE	tokens            	Throwback 	Throwback.tokens     	ENABLED 	26  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/Tokens	arn:euca:bootstrap:Throwback:tokens:Throwback.tokens/
SERVICE	reporting         	bootstrap 	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	26  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	jetty             	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	26  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Jetty	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	imaging           	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	26  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Imaging	arn:euca:eucalyptus::imaging:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	notifications     	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	26  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	dns               	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	26  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Dns	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.10.55/
{code}

comments.body:
I was able to get instances to register without any issues. 

[~hspencer] 

How long did you wait? My instance took about 1 minute to show up.

Hey [~viglesias],

I waited all night and they still did not associate themselves to the Load Balancer.  Did you register them manually or did they automatically show up once either the following was done:

* the autoscaling group was created after the load balancer was created

or 

* the autoscaling group was created before the load balancer was created

I was able to reproduce this in both situations.

I just checked this and instances were registered to ELB...
the autoscaling group was created after the load balancer was created

On AWS, I noticed that it doesn't matter what order the autoscaling group and load balancer are created.  The instances associated with the autoscaling group are always added to the load balancer (without having to use [as-attach-instances|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/DeveloperGuide/attach-instance-asg.html])

{code}
### AutoScaling Group Created First ###

2014-05-19 08:49:40 aws autoscaling create-auto-scaling-group --auto-scaling-group-name NginxScalingGroup --launch-configuration-name NginxLaunchConfiguration --min-size 2 --max-size 3 --load-balancer-names NginxLoadBalancer --health-check-type ELB --health-check-grace-period 300 --availability-zones us-east-1b --profile harold-work
2014-05-19 09:00:19 aws elb create-load-balancer --load-balancer-name NginxLoadBalancer --availability-zones us-east-1b --listeners Protocol=http,LoadBalancerPort=80,InstanceProtocol=http,InstancePort=80 --profile harold-work
2014-05-19 09:03:16 aws elb describe-instance-health --load-balancer-name NginxLoadBalancer --profile harold-work
INSTANCESTATES	Instance has not passed the configured HealthyThreshold number of health checks consecutively.	i-5e5ccb0e	Instance	OutOfService
INSTANCESTATES	Instance has not passed the configured HealthyThreshold number of health checks consecutively.	i-5f5ccb0f	Instance	OutOfService

### Load Balancer Created First ###

2014-05-19 09:11:56 aws elb create-load-balancer --load-balancer-name NginxLoadBalancerV2 --availability-zones us-east-1c --listeners Protocol=http,LoadBalancerPort=80,InstanceProtocol=http,InstancePort=80 --profile harold-work
2014-05-19 09:16:27 aws autoscaling create-auto-scaling-group --auto-scaling-group-name NginxScalingGroupV2 --launch-configuration-name NginxLaunchConfiguration --min-size 2 --max-size 3 --load-balancer-names NginxLoadBalancerV2 --health-check-type ELB --health-check-grace-period 300 --availability-zones us-east-1c --profile harold-work
2014-05-19 09:20:10 aws elb describe-instance-health --load-balancer-name NginxLoadBalancerV2 --profile harold-work
INSTANCESTATES	Instance has failed at least the UnhealthyThreshold number of health checks consecutively.	i-cde0579e	Instance	OutOfService
INSTANCESTATES	Instance has failed at least the UnhealthyThreshold number of health checks consecutively.	i-76ec5b25	Instance	OutOfService
{code}

[~viglesias],

After doing some additional testing, it looks like we require the Load Balancer to be created _before_ the AutoScaling group is created.

{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# eulb-create-lb -z UndergroundLuxury -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80,instance-protocol=HTTP" NginxLoadBalancerV2
DNS_NAME	NginxLoadBalancerV2-708773612111.lb.localhost
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euscale-create-auto-scaling-group NginxScalingGroupV2 --launch-configuration NginxLaunchConfigV2 --load-balancers NginxLoadBalancerV2 --availability-zones UndergroundLuxury --min-size 2 --max-size 2
....
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# date; eulb-describe-instance-health NginxLoadBalancerV2
Mon May 19 08:43:10 PDT 2014
INSTANCE	i-F9587E48	OutOfService
INSTANCE	i-3FED743E	OutOfService
{code}

However, I noticed the following:

* If the AutoScaling group is created before the Load Balancer, the AutoScaling group fails to create:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euscale-create-auto-scaling-group NginxScalingGroupV2 --launch-configuration NginxLaunchConfigV2 --load-balancers NginxLoadBalancerV2 --availability-zones UndergroundLuxury --min-size 2 --max-size 2
euscale-create-auto-scaling-group: error (ValidationError): Invalid parameters [Invalid load balancer name(s): [NginxLoadBalancerV2]]
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euscale-create-auto-scaling-group NginxScalingGroupV2 --launch-configuration NginxLaunchConfigV2 --load-balancers NginxLoadBalancerUser02 --availability-zones UndergroundLuxury --min-size 2 --max-size 2
euscale-create-auto-scaling-group: error (ValidationError): Invalid parameters [Invalid load balancer name(s): [NginxLoadBalancerUser02]]
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euscale-create-auto-scaling-group NginxScalingGroupV2 --launch-configuration NginxLaunchConfigV2 --load-balancers NginxLoadBalancerUserTwo --availability-zones UndergroundLuxury --min-size 2 --max-size 2
euscale-create-auto-scaling-group: error (ValidationError): Invalid parameters [Invalid load balancer name(s): [NginxLoadBalancerUserTwo]]

[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	NginxScalingGroup	NginxLaunchConfig	UndergroundLuxury	NginxLoadBalancer	0	0	0	NewestInstance
{code}
* If the load balancer is deleted, then re-created with the same name, the AutoScaling group instances are not registered with the load balancer:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# eulb-create-lb -z UndergroundLuxury -l "lb-port=80, protocol=HTTP, instance-port=80,instance-protocol=HTTP" NginxLoadBalancerV2
DNS_NAME	NginxLoadBalancerV2-708773612111.lb.localhost
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# date; eulb-describe-instance-health NginxLoadBalancerV2
Mon May 19 08:52:02 PDT 2014
[root@odc-f-13 ~]#
....
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# date; eulb-describe-instance-health NginxLoadBalancerV2
Mon May 19 08:55:06 PDT 2014
[root@odc-f-13 ~]#
.....
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# date; eulb-describe-instance-health NginxLoadBalancerV2
Mon May 19 08:58:58 PDT 2014
[root@odc-f-13 ~]#
{code}
* After the load balancer is deleted, then re-created with the same name, and the instances associated with the AutoScaling Group are terminated, then re-initialized, they join the load balancer:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euscale-update-auto-scaling-group -m 0 -M 0 --desired-capacity 0 NginxScalingGroupV2
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	NginxScalingGroup	NginxLaunchConfig	UndergroundLuxury	NginxLoadBalancer	0	0	0	NewestInstance
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	NginxScalingGroupV2	NginxLaunchConfigV2	UndergroundLuxury	NginxLoadBalancerV2	0	0	0	Default
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	NginxScalingGroup	NginxLaunchConfig	UndergroundLuxury	NginxLoadBalancer	0	0	0	NewestInstance
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	NginxScalingGroupV2	NginxLaunchConfigV2	UndergroundLuxury	NginxLoadBalancerV2	2	2	2	Default
INSTANCE	i-36A6226F	UndergroundLuxury	Pending	Healthy	NginxLaunchConfigV2
INSTANCE	i-9F70F41D	UndergroundLuxury	Pending	Healthy	NginxLaunchConfigV2
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# date; eulb-describe-instance-health NginxLoadBalancerV2
Mon May 19 09:07:26 PDT 2014
....
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# date; eulb-describe-instance-health NginxLoadBalancerV2
Mon May 19 09:08:04 PDT 2014
INSTANCE	i-9F70F41D	OutOfService
INSTANCE	i-36A6226F	OutOfService
{code}

Based upon this testing, it looks like we don't support the second use case where you create the Load Balancer after creating the AutoScaling group.

Hope this helps.

[~tony],

Thanks for the response.  The reason I tested different behaviors because I wanted to understand what would happen if the Load Balancer and/or AutoScaling group get terminated (deleted) prematurely.  Recently, we have been seeing a couple of incidents where NCs would crash due to heavy load.  I was curious to understand how we would recover from this behavior (i.e if the NC with the load balancer and/or autoscaling group just crashes).  The method that popped in my head first as to how I could get close to this behavior on AWS was to create/delete autoscaling and/or load balancers in different order.  Hope this helps.
This is a valid issue, but as we have a good procedure (and follow AWS best practices) we'll unblock 4.0.0 and look at this issue post-4.0

[~sjones] or [~spark]

What is the effort to fix this?
[~viglesias], we'd need to evaluate AWS behaviour to determine if this was something we would want to change.

[~sjones]/[~viglesias]:

The evaluation regarding the behavior on AWS can be found [here|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-9419?focusedCommentId=70522&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-70522].  Let me know if you need any additional information.

[~hspencer], we would evaluate the behaviour of AWS/Auto Scaling when creating resources out of order, specifically with regards to timing of resource creation. We would also evaluate the behaviour for instance registration when deleting and re-creating an ELB.
I apologize, I have no recollection why this got assigned to me. Perhaps to ensure the known issue is documented for 4.1?
